body_html:
@martinwicke Very cool feature, I am looking forward to adapt it for hyperopt or something like that!
But for now, I stuck with very simple question: is there any simple way to give it ability to run several experiments in parallel (independently)? Or I must specify tf.server for that? Maybe you can help with some advice or best practices, guide?
body_text:
@martinwicke Very cool feature, I am looking forward to adapt it for hyperopt or something like that!
But for now, I stuck with very simple question: is there any simple way to give it ability to run several experiments in parallel (independently)? Or I must specify tf.server for that? Maybe you can help with some advice or best practices, guide?
body:
@martinwicke Very cool feature, I am looking forward to adapt it for hyperopt or something like that!
But for now, I stuck with very simple question: is there any simple way to give it ability to run several experiments in parallel (independently)? Or I **must** specify [tf.server](https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/train/Server#class_tftrainserver) for that? Maybe you can help with some advice or best practices, guide?
